content.title: Financial Health Assessment and Recommendations
bullets: Insurance coverage gap of Rs. 85,600 detected.
EMI constitutes 82.7% of income, exceeding 40% benchmark.
No emergency fund; recommended is 6+ months.
Immediate action needed to improve financial health.
paragraphs: The current financial assessment indicates significant areas of concern. The saving rate is notably low, and the client is underinsured by Rs. 85,600. Additionally, the EMI burden is excessively high, consuming 82.7% of the income, which is well above the recommended 40% threshold.

There is also a lack of an emergency fund, which should ideally cover at least six months of expenses. These factors contribute to a poor financial health score, necessitating immediate corrective actions to stabilize and improve the financial situation.
actions: Increase savings rate to at least 20% of income.
Secure insurance coverage to close the Rs. 85,600 gap.
Reduce EMI to below 40% of income.
Establish an emergency fund covering 6 months of expenses.
Review and adjust monthly budget to improve surplus.
